Name: Tempus Quest: Episode 8 – Setting up Shop
Description:
After aiding the downed Liberation ships, the Tempus follows them into space, her home planet no longer safe. A nearby moon has been chosen for the Liberation's new headquarters. These ships are loaded with supplies and crew to build it, but any help would be appreciated.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer

Name: Tempus Quest: Episode 10 – The Asteroid Scene
Description:
Having completed their attack on the Dynasty outpost the Liberation fleet attempts a hasty retreat but are cut off by an armada of Dynasty reinforcements. Seeing an escape route, the Tempus leads the other ships into an asteroid belt, hoping the armada wouldn't be so bold as to do the same.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer

Name: The Big Score
Description:
A dicey game about getting in and getting out.

Inspired in the cult film Ocean's  Eleven.


The Big Score is a competitive craps-like dice rolling game about attempting to rob a casino and get out first.

The game is played over multiple rounds, with each round having the players take turns trying to move their crew to the vault, or out past the lobby, while the non-active players place bets on what they will roll, trying to get a bonus advancement for their own crew.


The Big Score is the postcard game from Button Shy's April 2016 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.

Name: Tubthumping
Description:
Get knocked down, but get up again in this barroom brawl.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Tubthumping by Chumbawamba.

Chip Beauvais and Sara Beauvais team up again for the third(?) Button Shy project, and I imagine there are more to come too. In Thubtumping, players will try to get one of each drink (coin) by fistbumping a player that has a smaller coin than you. Being realtime, it can feel like a barroom brawl, and with all of those fists flying, it could accidentally turn into one.

—description from the publisher


Tubthumping is a simultaneous play competitive game of drinking and brawling. Players supply coins or tokens to play, and attempt to win mini-brawls with each other in order to collect one coin or token of each color. The first one to do so wins.


Tubthumping is the postcard game from Button Shy's June 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: What's Your Number?!
Description:
You have something to hold onto, but are a few digits short.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song 867-5309 / Jenny by Tommy Tutone.

Ryan Cowler designed a game about missing digits, for what may be the most famous phone number ever, 867-5309. Tommy Tutone (remember them? or him? Nope.) caused some chaos for a few unlucky people that actually had this phone number in the 80's and 90's, and now you can cause some of your own by trying to mix up the digits for your opponent.

—description from the publisher


What's Your Number?! is a Mastermind type game of one player setting a pattern, and the others trying to figure out the pattern, all themed around figuring out the phone number that Jenny wrote on your hand at the club last night... All you can make out is 867-XXXX


What's Your Number?! is the postcard game from Button Shy's July 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Flo'Busta
Description:
Try not to drop the beat.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Ice Ice Baby by Vanilla Ice.


Flo'Busta card-drafting game of making mixes in the club for 2-4 players. Each turn you draft a card matching either the suit or rank of you previous card, taking a face down card if you can't match. The player with the longest run of matched cards after 10 rounds is the winner.

Flo'Busta is the postcard game from Button Shy's August 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Fast as Lightning
Description:
Use expert fighting and it won't be frightening.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Kung Fu Fighting by Carl Douglas.


Fast as Lightning is a real-time card shedding game in which 2 players compete to get rid of their cards as fast as possible while preventing their opponent from doing the same.


Fast as Lightning is the postcard game from Button Shy's September 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Slam Dance
Description:
Show off your skills in the mosh pit.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song The Safety Dance by Men Without Hats.


Slam Dance is a card and dice game for 2 or 4 (partnership) players. where each player or team attempts to be the best dancer in a mosh pit simulated with dice and playing cards that the players provide.


Slam Dance is the postcard game from Button Shy's October 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Funkytown
Description:
Move and groove your way into Funkytown.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Funkytown by Lipps Inc..


Funkytown is an action selection game of dancing down the road to Funkytown. Players use a deck of cards to simulate their moves and guide their tokens on the board to the section of Funkytown that they have to reach. First player to reach their location wins and gets their groove on.


Funkytown is the postcard game from Button Shy's November 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.
Families: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

Name: Lost in the Shadows
Description:
Inspired on the cult film The Lost Boys.


Lost in the Shadows is a hidden role game where the players take on the role of citizens of Santa Carla who are suffering the wrath of a vampire. They must work together to uncover who among them is the head vampire and stop them before time runs out.


Postcard release in the January 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Safari Ship
Description:
From the ruins of the Ancients to the natural wonders of innumerable worlds, the galaxy boasts indescribable splendors.  For those with the means, the captains and crews of Safari vessels stand ready to provide their clients with a once-in-a-lifetime experience.  Most trips are carefully curated, offering the idle rich a taste of adventure within the safe confines of five-star accommodations.  But it’s for the thrill seeker that the Safari ships are best suited, who feel the thrill of the hunt and a brush (or two) with death and destruction are the best vacations.

Print-on-demand 11-card mini deck containing:
1x Safari Ship Card
2x The Resonance Caves Adventure Card
2x Star Tours Adventure Card
3x Rufus Bartle Crew Card
3x Precendence Highport Connection Card

This is not a standalone product and needs other decks to be usuable. No new rules added.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Goat Slingers
Description: Your goal is simple: launch your goat, land it on the cliffs and try to be the last one standing. Ready, set, GOAT! Grab the Goat-a-pult, pull down on the launcher and fling your goat onto the cliffs. If your goat sticks the landing, collect your token(s) and leave your goat in place until your next turn to create an obstacle for your opponents!

Name: Mister Rogers' Neighborhood: The Game
Description:
In this simple-to-learn children's game, players spin the spinner and move their trolleys around the board, attempting to visit each of the landmarks and neighbors in the Neighborhood of Make-Believe: Grandpere at the Eiffel Tower, King Friday and Queen Sara at the castle, Corny at the Rock-It Factory, X & Henrietta Pussycat at the tree, Lady Elaine at the Museum-Go-Round, Dr. Bill and Elsie Jean at the platypus mound, and Daniel Tiger at the clock.

Along the way, Mister Rogers cards offer bonuses and penalties (often with a motivational thought to soften the blow of the penalties). Landing on a Trolley space offers an extra turn.

The game offers three methods of play:
1. Players must circle the board and collect all seven of the Neighbor cards by landing at the colored landmarks for each one.
2. Players start with all seven cards and must "drop off" each Neighbor at their landmarks.
3. The "Advanced" game, in which players must collect all seven neighbor cards, and once all seven are collected, drop them off.

The game box suggests a minimum age of 6 years old, but the game is about on par with something like Candy Land. Ages 4 and 5 can learn and play it.

Name: Caves of Rwenzori: The Monsoon Expansion
Description: The Monsoon Expansion brings the unpredictable, merciless power of nature to your Caves of Rwenzori adventure. As the monsoon pours and the underground rivers rise, beware! The Monsoon Expansion adds an extra 20 tiles to the game, one custom-made die and a new, dynamic but simple rule set that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Take a deep breath!

Name: Caves of Rwenzori: Legend of the Shadow Ape
Description: Legend tells of the Shadow Ape, a wild beast hidden deep in the dark forgotten belly of the caves. When it catches your scent and roars in the darkness, take out your weapons because nothing will stop his pursuit! The Legend of the Shadow Ape expansion brings new possibilities, challenges and excitement into the game. It includes 12 newly designed weapon cards, five large custom ape meeples, one custom-made die, five magnificently-designed Shadow Ape lair tiles and a pulse-racing new rule set. Run - The Shadows Ape is coming!

Name: The Confederate High Command: American Civil War Rules
Description:
Miniature Wargame rules for the American Civil War.

33 pages including casualty tables. Includes details of how to make shell burst circles in three sizes, a canister cone, and a shrapnel spider.

Scale:
1 mini = 33 men
1mm = 1 yard

Name: Battleship: Pirates of the Caribbean
Description:
Set sail on a swashbuckling adventure with this Pirates of the Caribbean Edition of the classic game of strategic combat, Battleship. Command your armada of five pirate ships as you search out the enemy, fire at coordinates and score hits with custom shaped powder kegs. Use special A Pirate’s Life cards to fire multiple hits.

—description by the publisher

Name: Candyland: Willy Wonka & The Chocolate Factory
Description:
All your favorite locations from the classic film Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory come to life on the custom illustrated Candy Land game board. Be the first player to reach the Wonkavator by landing on the multi-colored rainbow space at the end of the path to win!

Contents:
1 Custom Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory Game Board
66 Cards
4 Oompa Loompa Movers
Rules

- description by the publisher
Families: Books: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

Name: Trick‘n Trouble: SPIEL Essen promo card
Description:
Promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 1/4/0

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

Name: Trick‘n Trouble: Käsekuchen ohne Rosinen promo card
Description:
Cheescake without raisins Promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 0/1/4

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

Name: Mainports
Description:
Welcome to Europe! Discover its mainports and all the opportunities this true EURO GAME offers.

Close profitable deals, stock up on fuel and embark on your first journey across the European continent.
Ship grain from Lisbon to St. Petersburg and pick up some coal in Hamburg to deliver the cargo in Rotterdam. Will you choose to travel through the rivers or can you make a short cut across the seas? Smart planning of routes can be decisive as well as good timing on the rondel. Pock up some extra cash if you come across the flourishing mainport! Expand your enterprise with new ships and the latest technologies to get a head start to your opponents.

—description from the back of the box
Families: Series: Ports of Europe (Hans van Tol)

Name: Die Säulen der Erde
Description:
Die Säulen der Erde (Sonderausgabe) is a special edition of the game of the same name Die Säulen der Erde / The Pillars of the Earth published in 2006 The Pillars of the Earth.

In addition to the base game, this edition also comes with the two official extensions: The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set and The Pillars of the Earth: New Craftsmen
Families: Series: The Pillars of the Earth (Kosmos)
Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Shingo!
Description:
Shingo is a set collecting game wherein 2-6 players try to score points by adding counters to a playmat that correspond to the same symbol and location on cards that they build a hand of during the game.

The game starts with a stack of cards being placed face down in the middle of the table, and three cards being peeled off and laid face up adjacent to the stack.

On each player's turn they select a card from the three face up ones and add it to their hand, and after doing so add a counter or counters to their playmat, according to whether they have a pink star in that location on the card they've picked up. If they have stars in multiple locations on the card, they add a counter to each of those locations on their playmat, whether or not they have a counter there already from a previous turn, and regardless of whether or not there is a nought or a cross in that location on another card.

Once every player has a hand of seven cards, the game ends and the players add up their points. For more info on scoring and other points, please follow the link to the rules file.

Name: Nusfjord: Solo Challenge
Description:
The Solo Challenge is a print and play consisting of 22 cards which will later be included in the Salmon Deck expansion (which will consist of 44 new buildings and 1 new elder).

Use these cards and see how many points you can score with them.

Name: 7 Wonders Duel: Agora
Description:
7 Wonders Duel: Agora features a new board called the Senate, comprising six separate chambers that provide players with benefits once they take possession of the area. Players can obtain a Senate chamber by taking senator cards. Should any player successfully take control of the majority of Senate chambers then they automatically win the game.

1 Senate board
24 Influence cubes (12 bronze and 12 silver)
13 Senator cards (7 Politicians and 6 Conspirators)
2 Wonder cards
16 Conspiracy cards
16 Decree tokens
2 Progress tokens
4 Military tokens
1 score pad
1 Player Aid card
1 rulebook

Name: FeWa-Würfelspiel
Description:
The players start at space 1 and have to reach space 50. Movement is determined by a die. If a pawn reaches an occupied space, the other pawn has to start anew from space 1. On some spaces the player learns, why it is a good idea to use FeWa laundry detergent and gets a reward for using FeWa or a penalty for beeing stupid enough to use another product.

This is a promotional game for FeWa laundry detergent (invented in 1932,today it's called "Perwoll"). The washing woman "Johanna" was created in 1938. Seems the figure wasn't named yet when the game was published.

—user summary

Name: Gaggle of Geese
Description:
A free PNP game for one player. You are the leader of a flock of Geese heading south for the winter. Lead your flock through the Hunters and avoid the lurking Eagles to reach the safety of the Marshlands.

You have six Geese that you must guide to safety by moving them each turn towards the Marshlands at the bottom of the gameboard. In your path are six Hunters who try to shoot you and eight Eagles who try to eat you. Each turn, you use dice rolls as an AI to determine their movements. If they reach any of your Geese, that bird is captured and removed from the board.

You win if at least one of your Geese reach safety in the Marshlands by successfully passing through the Hunters and Eagles. Variable levels of difficulty can be set by adjusting the number of Eagles on the board.

—description from the designer

Name: Bulls Bears
Description:
The board game bulls-bears about the stockpile. In the game you have to buy and sell stocks. The one who buys more than 50% of the shares wins. This is a board game with website interface. Website of the game is needed for make game mechanics easier.

At the beginning of the game all players have the same amount of money and shares. Player can buy or sell min 1 and max 9 shares on the turn. The share price changes depending on the players' decision. If more shares were sold than purchased, the price falls; if the opposite is true, the price rises.

After a few days of trading, the shareholders' meeting begins. Participants choose the amount of dividends.

The game ends when one of the participants buys more than 50 shares or becomes bankrupt.

Name: Star Conflict: Insurgency
Description:
The Galaxy is at war. An alliance of several High Lords of the Interstellar Empire has rebelled against the Em -
peror, in an attempt to seize power for themselves. After years of conflict, the loyalists have managed to defeat
the majority of the insurgent forces. The few remaining insurgents have gone into hiding in a secret base, where
they are now rebuilding their forces. Given enough time, they will be able to rally enough support to launch an-
other full-scale rebellion and defeat the Emperor once and for all. The loyalists are set to find the base and de-
stroy the last remnants of the opposition before this happens.

Star Conflict: Insurgency is a free print and play asymmetric wargame for two players, taking approximately 30
to 60 minutes to play.

One player takes control of the loyalists and one player of the insurgents. The loyalist player’s goal is to locate
and conquer the hidden insurgent base. The insurgent player’s goal is to survive long enough to gather enough
support to overthrow the Emperor. Both players will muster armies, fight battles, and expand their galactic do-
main in order to reach their aim. The loyalists are more powerful and organized, but the insurgents have time and
the element of surprise on their side.

—description from the designer

Name: One Drunk Night...: N.S.F.S. (Not Safe For Society)
Description: A One Drunk Night expansion containing 100 cards (21 Beginning, 64 Middle, 21 End) deemed particularly crude and inappropriate.  The box contains a label warning of "potential catastrophic moral repercussions on your psyche".

Name: Crazier Eights: Pantheon
Description:
A fantasy card game with a Greek mythology theme. It is deck of 33 game cards with unique abilities. The first player with zero cards in hand wins.

This can be played as a stand alone game. It was also made to be mixed with Crazier Eights: Olympus, or any other version of the game other than the first edition.

—description from the designer

Name: Compendium: The Overlord – Tome IV (fan expansion for Batman)
Description:
A collection of fan-designed scenarios available through the-overlord.com

4 game-play scenarios for Monolith games:

     Resuscitation (Batman: Gotham City Chronicles)
     Claustrobowl (Claustrophobia 1643)
     Tournament pool — A selection of powerful and varied units (Mythic Battles: Pantheon)
     Razzia in Aquilonie (Conan)


Also includes:

     Removable Game aides for Batman: Gotham City Chronicles
     Character Bios and Painting guide for Batman: Gotham City Chronicles
     Master of the Hounds — A story set in the world of Claustrophobia 1643

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Portable Batcomputer Promo
Description:
Promo card representing the portable batcomputer that gives re-rolls on complex thought and manipulation actions.

Included with the The Overlord #4

Name: Edge of Darkness: Guilds Power Pack Expansion
Description:
The Guilds Power Pack consists of 4 double-sided Location boards; 1 board for each Guild, with two different Guild Locations and 16 Guild Advancement Starter Slips which replace the default Guild Advancement Starter Slips which come with the Base Game.

Each Guild Location adds asymmetric starting conditions for the Guild and a special ability available only to that Guild. The new Citizens & Patricians on the Guild Advancement Starter Slips provide new abilities and interact with this Location.

Contents:
4 guild location boards
16 card advancements
56 influential/goodwill plastic tokens
56 influential/goodwill cardboard tokens
1 cloth bag (to replace the leatherette bag)
1 rulebook

Related:
The Guilds Power Pack was released in addition to the Cliffs of Coldharbor expansion in the same Kickstarter campaign. As of January 2022 it does not appear to be available separately at retail

Name: A Baton in Both Hands
Description:
A set of solo wargame rules that were designed for the horse and musket period but could be used for others.

Rules were designed so that any type of engagement could be played at any figure scale or basing type.

The player controls both sides in a solo wargame.

Name: Batallitas
Description:
Batallitas is a very simple wargame for two players. Its game system allows to create historical armies until the middle ages as well as fantasy armies. It is an easy game to explain and very cheap to manufacture. It is a fast game, in total about 20 minutes per battle, which aims to have more fun than being faithful to history, although it tries to find a bit of rigor within its simplicity.
The game consists of moving, and attacking and defending with dice of 6. It is surely too easy for anyone looking to recreate, but it is suitable for children.

—description from the designer

“Batallitas” es un wargame muy sencillo para dos jugadores. Su sistema de juego permite crear ejércitos históricos hasta el medievo así como ejércitos de fantasía. Es un juego fácil de explicar y muy económico de fabricar. Se trata de un juego rápido, en total unos 20 minutos por batalla, que pretende divertir más que ser fiel a la historia, aunque intenta buscar un poco de rigor dentro de su simpleza.
El juego consiste en mover, y atacar y defender con dados de 6. Seguramente es demasiado sencillo para quien busque recrear, pero es apto para niños.
—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Holmes: Sherlock & Mycroft – Sherrinford Holmes Promo Card
Description:
Promo card available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Adventurer Pack (and possibly elsewhere).

The oldest of the Holmes brothers has shown up —which allows each player to take 1 hidden clue or 2 investigation markers.

Name: Chronicles of Crime: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
Description:
Four new character cards. These, combined with Chronicles of Crime: Dice Tower 2019 Promo Cards are part of a brand new adventure that will launch on the app later in 2020.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Adventurer Pack.

Name: War of Dice
Description:
War of Dice is a print&play board game designed to play in solo mode.

In War of Dice you have to face an enemy contingent, who came to conquer the world. Armies are represented by dice. Each die represents a troop, and the value of the die, which you face upwards, represents the number of health points of the troop.

â€‹The goal is to eliminate enemy troops.

To play it you only need standard six-sided dices and print the game board on an A4 sheet.

—description from the designer

Name: Age of Dirt: Firepit Promo Card
Description:
A new card for Age of Dirt! It reads:

Discard this card to either
... avoid an event OR renew the To-Do-Wall.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builder Pack.

Name: Tiny Epic Tactics: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
Description:
A pack of 4 new characters for Tiny Epic Tactics!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builder Pack.

Suz
Serpent Stone: Deal +2 damage if she is in a water space.
Sea Legs: Gain 2 health if she ends her movement in a water space.

Roy
Lumberguard: If he is in a forest space, all allies within 4 take 1 less damage from all attacks.

Vasel
Tom's Blessing: All allies within range gain 1 health.

Zee
Tower Sword: If he is knocked back by a melee attack, the attacker immediately takes 2 damage.

Name: Etherfields: Search Mini Deck
Description:
The World of Dreams is vast and ever changing. In order to make your dreamy adventures easier, you have learned how to search for the tiniest of clues. The Search mini-deck will allow you to look deeper into your own dreams. But will you like what you will find?

Contents: 1 Rules card and new Search mini-deck consisting of 8 cards.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.

Name: Dragonscales: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
Description:
Five new cards for use in Dragonscales!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack:

Tower of Stone, Tower of Protection, Tower of the Undead, Dicey Trade, Curse of the Dice Tower.

Name: Adrenaline: Solo Play DLC
Description:
Something went wrong, very wrong. You're back in the arena, lying on a spawnpoint. Shaking the dizziness out of your head, you struggle to your feet. Your eyes strain to focus in the dimness. The spawnpoint no longer lights the room with a cheerful glow. Now its light feels malevolent, corrupted.

You hear footsteps. It's your old friends, your old enemies, coming to play a game with you. Right now, you're not sure you're up to it. Something about that spawning —

Three figures walk through the door. Their heads turn, and they all focus on you. Their pitiless eyes reflect the spawnpoint's sinister light, and you realize that this is not just another friendly free-for-all. A malevolent intelligence is controlling the others...and it wants you dead.

Adrenaline: Solo Play DLC is the official single-player variant of Adrenaline and is fully compatible with the Team Play DLC expansion. The rules are mostly like Adrenaline, so you already know most of what you need to know.

You can find the rules in the "Files" section or directly in this .pdf link https://czechgames.com/files/rules/adrenaline-solo-rules-en.pdf.

Name: Spyfest: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
Description:
Three brand-new cards for use in the upcoming game SpyCon!

Includes: Kong, Hat, and a rules card.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.

Name: TRIAMAND
Description:
TRIAMAND. Somewhere in a remote desert, an ancient tomb has been disturbed. An evil spirit has woken and is threatening to the whole world with an act of revenge. 
  You as a player need to save the world. The world counts on you! You must put bricks back on a tomb. Do it first, and you are the winner!!! 
  Game is played by 2 – 6 people, ages 7+. At the start, each player is given 5 playing cards, for which can be acquired bricks from the Brickbank. The bricks have different shapes and correspond to the color of the card. Amount paid for each brick can be the same as the price or higher. If brick is bought for its stated nominal value, a player can make an additional move. If paid by the nominal, it can be bought as many bricks as laying on the Brickbank (not from the treasury storage). After the player’s turn is over, every time empty brick spots on the Brickbank must be covered by new bricks.
  First move on the game is given to the player with highest value card. If several players have similar highest cards, they are comparing their next highest cards until someone has an upper hand.  
  On players turn, can be made one of the following:
-    Card drawn from the stock
-    Brick bought from the Brickbank
-    Brick removed /replaced. * if a row is completed, no brick can be removed or replaced.  
  Seems too easy? Not so fast, my friend. Competition is quite hard, and players need to come up with some strategy in order to succeed. Here are some hurdles: 
-    Although some bricks stretch up to the next rows, which is acceptable, player cannot build next row without completely bricklaying preceding one.
-    You have laid almost all bricks and now have stuck for some particular piece: don’t have necessary currency to buy this exact brick? Think strategy again: maybe you don’t need to cover up row too fast before you acquire necessary resources from the Brickbank. You need to be good at reading patterns. 
-    First move always starts from the left bottom corner marked with red. Next moves can be done freely, but within the same row until it is filled and ready to move to the upper one.  
 Good luck!!!
  Notice: Game is claimed strategic, and it truly is. In order to win, players must plan their movements in advance. The higher up the pyramid player climbs, the fewer choices one has and has to be very careful. Game is well suitable for school children to develop strategic thinking, to learn better geometrical shapes, and learn to count. Game is fun for adults also and is not burdening with the time required- just about 30 minutes to play one round. Quite addictive: lost players want a replay to get the satisfaction.

—description from the designer

Name: Asking for Trobils: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
Description:
Five new cards for Asking for Trobils: Zeegar-C-a and Tomva-Sel.

Includes:
Su-Zan - When drawing a Riffraff card at Smashed Rock, draw two and keep one. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing Pad on Smashed Rock.

Er-Riic - When going to the Tyson Comet, players may gain two Crystals and one other Crystal, ore, Space Carrot, or Credit. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing pad on Tyson Comet.

Tomva-Sel - When throwing Trobils in for credits, a player may choose to receive ore, crystals, or space carrots instead. What is received must be all the same.

Ma-Ndi - When going to the Nye Asteroid Belt, players may gain two ore and one other crystal, ore, space carrot, or credit. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing Pad on the Nye Asteroid Belt.

Zeegar-C-a - The price for entering the Wormhole is different when Zeegar-C-a appears. Use this card to cover and replace the Landing Pad on the Wormhole.

Name: Unoriginal
Description:
Player race against each other to match their cards and be the first to use them all. The game takes the basic mechanics of Crazy Eights, and adds a large amount of cruelty and strategy in the form of SCREW Cards.

SCREW Cards make up about 20% of the deck and each card is unique in both its design and game mechanics. These cards are one time use only and are designed to backfire on the player using them if played carelessly.

Each SCREW Card has multiple uses included so that players can fine tune the rules of the game to accommodate their preferred play style.

—description from the designer

Name: Secrets of the Lost Station: Dr. Quatuormanus XVI
Description:
A new card for Secrets of the Lost Station. This character's name is a Latin version of Qua(r)termain, clearly an allusion to H. Rider Haggard's Allan Quatermain.

Stamina: 13
Ability: Once per game, you may choose to flip this card and take another turn after this one. (Do not advance Station Track)

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.

Name: The Everrain: New Sea Events
Description:
Three sea event cards—these 3 promo cards add a brand new and exclusive story to The Everrain.

Was supposed to be available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack, but never produced: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/tomvasel/dice-tower-2020/posts/3016083

Name: Wild Assent: Exclusive Workers Promo Cards
Description:
A promo pack of five exclusive workers for Wild Assent!

Includes:
Jungle Guide - Draw 2 random resources at the end of each encounter and discard 1.

Herald - Heal 1 seeker for 20 after each encounter.

Hunt Director - At the start of each encounter, all seekers have +3 health. Once lost, this health may not be healed.

Gryphon Whisperer - Threat 3 creatures sell for 2 additional gold at the Silvestrem.

Illusionist - At the start of each encounter, discard the first instinct card drawn. Do not draw a new card.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.

Name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Common Field Promos
Description:
Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

A set of new common field promos. These give players access to harvest resources that they normally have limited access to. But there is only one harvest per field. Who will claim them first?

At the start of the game place all of the common fields in the middle. Every time you Harvest, you can harvest one of the common fields (instead of harvesting one of yours). Turn it face down afterwards, to mark it as used - it can't be used anymore this round. After each round turn all of the common fields face up.

Name: Dungeon Party: Dice Tower Coasters
Description:
A set of four new tiles for the upcoming Dungeon Party game from Forbidden Games!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

The four tiles are Game Room, Gem Dice Tower, Vasel Paladin, and Zee-Ogre.

Name: Sagrada: Promo 10 – Dice Tower 2020 Window Pattern Card
Description:
A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window in. Shuffle into the deck with the other player cards during setup and proceed as normal.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

Name: Sleeping Gods: Saxophone Promo Card
Description:
A saxophone item card for Sleeping Gods! It allows one to equip an ability card for free and remove a "low morale" status token.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

Name: Reavers of Midgard: Finnish Linens Promo Cards
Description:
A six card set for Reavers of Midgard! It adds six Finnish Linens cards to collect.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

Name: Bushido: Focused Chi Promo Card
Description:
A new promo for Bushido! This card can be used to boost any other card.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

Name: Mysthea: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
Description:
An exclusive set of 9 encounters for Mysthea and new unique outcomes!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

Name: Bees: The Secret Kingdom – Instant Win Promo Card
Description:
A new promo card for Bees: the Secret Kingdom! It adds an Instant Win condition consisting of having two sets of Honey cards with certain values.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

Name: Silver: Marauder Promo Pack
Description:
A promo pack for Silver. This was available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

The card has a value of 12, and says, "Replace each faceup card of a specific value with a card from the deck, placing each faceup card on the bottom of the discard pile."

When you draw this card, you may replace each faceup card of a value you choose with a facedown card drawn from the deck. Those faceup cards are placed on the bottom of the discard pile.

All faceup cards from all villages with the chosen value must be replaced. Begin replacements to the active player's left. If the deck runs out before replacing all cards, the round ends normally.

Name: Dixit 2: "Dice Tower" Promo Card
Description:
A brand new card for use in Dixit!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.

Name: Welcome to Dinoworld: Dice Tower Duo Promo
Description:
A duo promo set for Welcome to Dinoworld!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.

Name: Conflicting Legends: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Pack
Description:
A promo pack of three cards for Conflicting Legends!

Ben Franklin - Choose an opponent. That opponent randomly discards a Persona in front of them (Culture/Green)

Sir Issac Newton - Use the ability of any Persona in front of a player (Science/Blue)

Leif Erikson - Attack an opponent. If you lose, attack a different opponent (Military/Red)

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.

Name: Sanctum: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
Description:
Three new cards for Sanctum.

Hat of Insight, whose three slots each copy an effect of another empty one-space ability of the same color.

Hammer of Fate - Before assigning hits, you may reroll all your dice once more.

Seal of Excellence - You get 3 tokens, stamina, or focus in any combination you choose.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.

Name: Skyfight: Air Combat Rules 1960-1985
Description:
Air battles rules for the 1960-1985 period

For 1/300th miniatures.

Name: Lee's Greatest Victory: Chancellorsville 1863
Description:
“My God! What will the Country say?"

-- President A. Lincoln

The Chancellorsville campaign, which took place in and around Virginia’s Wilderness in May 1863, is considered by many to be Robert E. Lee’s masterpiece, a true triumph “against the odds.” Opposing Lee was Union commander Joseph “Fighting Joe” Hooker, who had devised a plan that seemed assured of success. His cavalry would raid deep behind Confederate lines, cutting Lee’s supplies, while Hooker and four of his seven infantry corps would march west, then south, and appear behind the Confederate defenses opposite the city of Fredericksburg.

Lee would be compelled to withdraw south, in which case he would be pursued, or he would be compelled to attack with his numerically inferior army to avoid being crushed between the hammer and anvil of Hooker’s forces. “May God have mercy on General Lee, for I will have none,” Hooker declared.

No plan, however, survives first contact with enemy. With the advantage of interior lines and a great deal of audacity Lee would confound his opponent by continually bringing more rifles to the critical place at the critical time. And it didn’t’ hurt that Lee’s largest corps was commanded by one “Stonewall” Jackson. . . .

Lee’s Greatest Victory is an area-impulse game but one unlike anything seen before. Since the appearance of the “sunset die roll” nearly three decades ago players have alternated activating a single area, with variation coming in the form of an uncertain turn length. Play has a chess-like feel, with players able to act and react with a great deal of prior calculation. Short turns could be frustrating for one or both players. In this revolutionary development of the genre players no longer know how many impulses they, or their opponent, will have, creating both opportunities and crises that cannot be anticipated in advance—just like real combat. The “momentum” swings back and forth but rarely the same way twice. At the same time, each turn lasts as long as the players wish it to last, ensuring something will happen every turn.

Units of maneuver are Union divisions and Confederate brigades for the most part, with historical leaders present to provide a combat boost though at the risk of being wounded or KIA. Pontoon bridges and entrenchments are part of the basic rules while optional rules incorporate weather and optional units for both sides. Best of all, it's just six turns long and very playable in one sitting.

Content:

    Map - One full color 22"x34" mapsheet
    Counters - 176 full color 5/8" die-cut pieces
    Rules length - 12 pages
    Charts and tables - 2 pages
    Complexity - Medium
    Playing time - Up to 3 hours
    How challenging is it solitaire? - Poor


Design - Michael Rinella
Development - Paul Rohrbaugh
Graphics - Mark Mahaffey

(from the publisher's website)

Name: Sparkle*Kingdom
Description:
Welcome to Sparkle*Kingdom!

If you are just joining the Sparkle*Kitty series, you are in luck! This 100% FREE version was created to allow families and friends to enjoy a silly spell slinging game whether you are trapped together in towers or spread apart in different kingdoms. It’s a bit different from the base Sparkle*Kitty card game, but with the same adorable giggle jiggles, otter devastations and added coloring fun!

Players use a Sparkle deck from previous games (or online) to fill in their colors in their kingdom. The player with the highest score wins.

Name: Dice Tetris
Description:
Inspired by the video game TETRIS, except you play this version with the use of dice. Each turn you roll 6 colored dice and place them on the drop zone. Instead of having the shapes fall, you will be trying to arrange the dice to fall and make the shapes.  There are five colored dice that will be used to match all the similar colored shapes.

As each new shape is discovered, you will be trying to match the dice to these shapes before they move off the board and generate a new shape.  Each shape you match with the dice causes the dice to be removed from the board and the other dice to fall down into their place.

You start the 1 minute timer. You can use six actions to manipulate the dice to help you line them up and create stacks to generate the shapes. If you run out of time, the dice fall as they are.

Try to create as many shapes as possible to collect the highest score.  Be careful with your actions because if you leave too many dice on the board, they may start to stack too high and cause you to lose the game.

Name: Chai: High Tea
Description:
Celebrate the diversity of tea cultures in Chai: High Tea, an expansion for Chai! Merchants spice up their teahouses with new player powers, featuring afternoon tea to refreshing horchata, or a sip of yerba mate.

Tea merchants receive unique double-sided ability boards at the start of the game. Abilities are used as an optional free action on a turn, and the board flips over whenever an ability is used.

This expansion includes 6 ability boards with 12 unique abilities, in addition to 2 transparent dice. Additional rules make the expansion compatible with Chai’s solo and co-op gameplay.

-description from publisher

Name: Willkommen im deutschen Weinparadies
Description:
Each player has a pawn and travels on the board showing a route through the (Western) German wine cultivation regions according to the roll of a die. If you roll a 1 or 2, you may draw a card and follow the instruction or answer the question instead of advancing your pawn. For a correct answer you get a wine box tile (that may contain from 6 to 30 bottles). If a player reaches the last space, the game ends and the player with the most bottles wins.

This game was produced by Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburg, Industrie- und Promotion-Service as a commercial game.

—user summary

Name: Climate Change
Description:
Everything starts in the savannah. It’s pleasantly warm and it does not rain very often. Different species are living in there, perfectly adapted to their habitat. Life is easy.
Temperature and rainfall are not the same everywhere, so the world is divided in four habitats based of the climate in each area. Each round covers approximately one million years, in which the species can move and evolve, by adapting to new habitats.
Every now and then the climate changes globally. When the temperature increases the savannah expands; when it drops it shrinks and the ice grows, while the other habitats move accordingly. In order to survive, species should either move to follow their habitats or adapt quickly to new ones, if they are not able to do so they will go extinct. And, after a while, humans may arrive and start changing things…

Name: Quarantine
Description:
Quarantine is a cooperative board game where players are quarantined at home, fending off a virus, conserving their food and trying to find a cure.

Each player takes on the role of a family member, who all have different character traits for how much they can move and carry, which are all useful to be successful in the game. They must keep socially distanced from one another (two spaces) while moving around the house, avoiding the virus tokens which replicate as the game progresses, and collecting the item tokens needed to make a cure. Each player can carry 10 food tokens (25 for Granny) and these are exchanged for movement and can be restocked from the kitchen but the supply is limited so be careful, if the food supply runs out or someone catches the virus the game is over.

Each turn consists of movement and/or an action (restock food, disinfect spaces, mix cure items or knock down walls to escape the virus). Movement is dictated by the number of food a player wishes and each player has a number of spaces that their character is permitted to move per food.

After each turn players draw a card from the research deck, this identifies either a new item or new virus in the house or gives the player a powerup to use later (extra moves, search the deck, haz-mat suit for temporary virus immunity). Following a round (one go for each player) all the viruses on the board are moved one space closer to the nearest player. Most viruses appear outside the house and need to break in, giving players time to prepare, but occasionally new viruses appear inside the house and urgent disinfection is required.

The mechanic for placing viruses involves a D12, with two faces for internal placement and 10 for external. New items from the research deck are placed with a D20 (room selection) and a D6 (space selection). Dice are not involved in player movement or decision outcomes.

The game ends when either a player runs out of food, a player succumbs to the virus or the parts of the cure are mixed and the cure is completed.

Name: Carcassonne: Halb so Wild
Description:
Carcassonne: Halb so wild is a mini-expansion consisting of 24 triangular landscape tiles that are half the size of a normal Carcassonne  tile. Each player receives 2 triangular tiles during setup, & can place them during their turns instead of drawing & placing a normal tile.

This set combines Halb so wild I & Halb so wild II, with updated art matching the 2.0 and 3.0 versions of the base game. Both mini-expansions are now bundled & sold together by Hans im Glück — originally Halb so wild I was only available through Spielbox. Part of the Carcassonne series.

Name: Gnome Elf Troll
Description:
Create and cultivate your own magical garden. Each turn, you will be placing tiles to produce crops and harvest magic beans, enchanted apples and cursed pumpkins. Hire and place gnomes, elves and trolls to harvest even more crops or to spoil your opponents production. The first player to harvest 10 crops of the same type wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lords of Florence
Description:
Lords of Florence recreates the battle for political control of the Republic of Florence in the time of the Renaissance, a period famous for bankers, spectacular art, literature, betrayal and bloody conflict.Players control powerful families and individuals who together ruled the Republic during its 300 year history, as members of the Signoria (the ruling council of Florence), together they compete to gain enough political power (VPs) to overthrow the Republic and be named Duke.

Over 6 turns, players race to earn the most political power (VPs), if any player earns 50 political power, at the end of any turn before the end of turn 6, they automatically win.

In a turn, players spend their resources to complete shared projects, which in turn provide resources and VPs when completed. Projects are expensive, so players are encouraged to cooperate to complete them; yet the assymetric player powers mean some projects are more beneficial for some players than others. Therefore players must consider carefully whether to cooperate or not. In addition, each turn players may blind bid for intrigue cards, which provide opportunities to attack other players, disrupt projects they have completed, steal resources or even provide alternative victory conditions. However, players who focus too much on attacking others will not only fail to complete projects that would benefit them, but also risk triggering the shared loss condition. Failing to complete projects comes with a price - increasing the threat of the shared loss condition (known as instability), as the people of Florence become angry that their demands to complete projects are disregarded. If instability rises too far, the players all lose, forcing players to cooperatively complete at least some projects every turn to avoid defeat.

Player resources and intrigue cards are hidden behind player shields, allowing players to bluff, extort and hide their true strategies. The game rewards careful planning, timing and ruthlessness – all qualities critical to political success in the cutthroat World of Renaissance Italy

—description from the publisher

Name: Around Australia Car Trial
Description:
Around Australia Car Trial is a three-dimensional game of skill to navigate a car similar to a FX Holden around a winding course in Australia.

Published in the mid to late 1950s. The colorful board has a map of Australia overlaid by a road that begins near Melbourne and finishes near Perth. Interesting the game board displays several Mobil gas stations with the red Pegasus logo.

The plastic car is steered along the path using a magnetic control device, situated under the board. It passes through plastic tunnels along its travels. Points are scored by passing cities or time trials can be played. The player with the most points or fastest time is the winner.

The game is similar to Tarco games produced in the US around about the same time period and published by Sidney A Tarrson Co.

—user summary

Name: Oceans: Exclusive Promo Cards
Description:
A pack of promo cards for Oceans that consists of 10 new Deep cards and 15 new Scenario cards.

Ocean promo cards are foiled to distinguish them from the normal cards in the game. Foiled promo cards are either more complex, more aggressive, or more chaotic than the normal non-foiled cards (or sometimes just humorous).

New Deep cards:
Bioluminescent Lure
Electric Discharge
Hybridization
Intelligence
Invasive Predator
Migratory Exodus
Mimicry
Overgrazing
Paralyzing Venom
Sparkles

New Scenario Cards:
Aggressive Environment
Coral Bleaching
Evolutionary Arms Race
Horizontal Gene Transfer
Hostile Conditions
Hostile Environment
Lazy Creator
Mass Migration
Parallel Universe
Prescient Mutations
Radiation Blast
Schadenfreude
Shallow Reef
Snowball Earth
Über Inhospitable Environment

Name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Mystified Murderess
Description:
In this cooperative game, you investigate criminal cases along with the most notorious detective of all time. Follow the leads and gather clues. Go with your team and explore London in the Victorian era. To beat Sherlock Holmes at this game, carefully read the newspapers, follow your intuition, and use your deduction capacities.

This is case 3 from Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases, which has been made available on its own as a Print & Play.

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for The Magic Carrot: Cake Batter Booster Deck
Description:
The Killer Bunnies chefs have mixed flour, eggs, sugar and radiation to take the cake in this pastry-packed permutation. The Cake Batter Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set and 10 bonus KinderBunnies Carrots!

If bunnies are many, and you need to clear room, combine Atomic Pastry and make them go boom! Cathexis bunnies use their power to persuade, to build armies of bunnies of the same shade. Form the big words for Dr. Shoe by putting lettered Carrots in the right queue!

When having no food gives you frowns, you’ll be relieved to see the Honey Hash Browns. You’ll smile each hour, and never be dour, when you feel the power of the glowing flour! Fluffy, delicious and it won’t make you fatter, if you play the latest deck Cake Batter!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Stars, Bars & Tars: Civil War Naval Rules
Description:
Star, Bars & Tar

Naval Warfare during the American Civil War 1861-1865. 
Both Steam and sailing rules. 
Realistic movement rules, no hexes. 
Combat cards, wind templates, speed scales, turning circles and damage cards provided.

Data for over 190 classes of ships

scale : 1:500 or less

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Fast Play Naval Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Stars, Bars & Tars: Scenario Book One – Civil War Naval Actions I
Description:
This civil War naval scenario Book covers four Civil War naval Battles between Union and Confederate Ships.

It can be played with any scale of ships.

Also you can get the Civil war rules Stars, Bars & tars or play with another set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighting Sail: Fast Play Naval Rules for the Age of Sail
Description:
Fighting Sail: Fast Play Naval Rules for the Age of Sail

Naval Warfare from 1650 to the age of steam.

Realistic sailing rules with no hexes. Combat Cards, Wind Templates, Turning Circles and Damage Cards are all provided.

Fighting Sail has data for over 400 ships.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Fast Play Naval Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Coal & Iron: Fast Play Ironclad Rules
Description:
Coal & Iron: Fast Play Ironclad Rules

Naval Warfare during the European Ironclad Era 1860-1880. Realistic movement rules, no hexes.

Combat cards, speed scales, turning circles and damage cards provided.

Coal & Iron has data for over 220 classes of ships of 18 navies.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Fast Play Naval Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Freedom Five Promo Cards
Description:
These are variant cards of 5 of the heroes.

Freedom Five: Tachyon - Blitz: Tachyon deals 1 Target 1 melee damage. You may move a Burst card from your Trash to the bottom of your deck. IF you do, use this Power again now.

Freedom Five: Wraith - Clandestine Funding: Draw a card. Until the end of your next turn, whenever you Draw a card, you may Discard a card. If you do, another Player Draws a card.

Freedom Five: Absolute Zero - Pilot Light: Absolute Zero deals himself 2 Fire Damage. If he takes Damage this way, search your Deck for an Ongoing Card and put it into play. Shuffle your Deck.

Freedom Five: Bunker - Tactical Uplink: Reveal then replace the top Card of each Hero Deck. If you reveal a Mode, put it into Play. One Player may put the top Card of their Deck into Play.

Freedom Five: Legacy - Overwatch: You may either move an Environment card in Play to the bottom of the Environment deck, or one Player may play a card.

Name: Sides of Steel III: Pre-Dreadnought Fast Play Naval Rules
Description:
Sides of Steel III: pre-Dreadnought Fast Play Naval Rules

Naval Warfare during the age of the pre-Dreadnought Battleship Era 1881-1906.

Realistic movement rules without hexes. Combat cards, speed scales, torpedo wakes turning circles, smoke templates and damage cards provided.

Sides of Steel III has data for over 220 classes of ships of 18 navies.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Fast Play Naval Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Dreadnought III: Fast Play WWI Naval Rules
Description:
Dreadnought III: Fast Play WWI Naval Rules

Naval Warfare during the age of the Dreadnought Battleship 1906-1930 Realistic movement rules, no hexes.

Combat cards, speed scales, torpedo wakes turning circles, smoke templates and damage cards provided.

Dreadnought III contains data for over 220 classes of ships of 14 navies.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Fast Play Naval Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Task Force III: Fast Play WWII Naval Rules
Description:
Task Force III: Fast Play WWII Naval Rules

Naval Warfare from 1930 – 1955 including WW2. 
Realistic movement rules, no hexes.

Includes both naval gunnery and carrier combat. Speed scales, turning circles, torpedo wakes, smoke templates and damage cards provided.

Data for over 190 classes of ships of 12 navies.

Scale: 1:2400 or smaller.

Charts, damage cards, and turning circles are included in each game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Fast Play Naval Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The XTREME Prime Wardens Promo Cards
Description:
These are variant cards of 5 of the heroes.

XTREME Prime Wardens: Fanatic - Kill the Spirit: Fanatic deals 1 Target 1 Radiant Damage. Until the end of your next turn, redirect all Damage dealt by Fanatic to that Target.

XTREME Prime Wardens: Tempest - Thunderstruck: Tempest deals 1 Target 1 Lightning damage. A Non-Character Target dealt damage this way loses any "End of Turn" effects on its card until the start of Tempest's next turn.

XTREME Prime Wardens: Haka - Die Hard: Select a Hero character card. Until the start of your next turn, redirect damage that would be dealt to that Target to Haka instead; whenever Haka is dealt damage this way, he regains 1 HP.

XTREME Prime Wardens: Captain Cosmic - Play With Madness: Captain Cosmic deals 1 Target 1 Energy Damage. Each Construct deals that Target 1 Energy Damage.

XTREME Prime Wardens: Argent Adept - Rebel Yell: The Argent Adept deals 1 Target other than himself 2 Sonic Damage. If a Hero is dealt Damage this way, they play a Card and use a Power.

Name: The Kings Musketeers are Wimps: Fast Play for Drinking and Brawling in the Age of Musketeers
Description:
The Kings Musketeers are Wimps

Fast play rules for dueling, drinking and brawling in the 17th century.

Each figure represents a single person.

The rules cover movement, fighting, drinking, gambling, and romance.

There’s even a surgeon to fix wounds.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.

Name: Odin's Way: Fast Play Viking Era Skirmish Rules
Description:
Odin’s Way are rules for the Viking Era. Each figure is an individual Viking or Saxon.

Odin’s Way can be used for a large or small game.

Rules include point values for fighting pillaging, gathering booty and capturing slaves.

There are even sailing rules!

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: March & Fight or Die! Colonial Era Skirmish Rules
Description:
March and Fight or Die ! are the Small War Skirmish rules for the colonial era from roughly the 1850s to the 1920s.

French Foreign Legion, the British and German Schutztruppen are all covered and so are their enemies.

Without heavy weapons 2-4 players can play on a card table.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Garands & Grenades: Fast Play World War II Rules
Description:
Garands & Grenades is the Small War skirmish rules set for World War II.

These rules are for infantry at squad and platoon level. Weapons include rifles, machine guns, grenades, bazookas, and Panzerfausts.

There are rules for tanks but they better not get too close to infantry armed with bazookas and Panzerfausts.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Agarra Dino
Description: Agarra Dino ("Grab the Dino") consists of dinosaur cards, color dice, a diet die and six colored dino meeples. There are four game modes with varying difficulty levels. In each of them, one card from the deck is revealed and one or more dice are rolled. Player must find matches between the cards and the dice, and grab one of the dinos in a corresponding color to receive a point token. When the deck is exhausted, the player with most tokens wins.

Name: The Mystery of the Queen's Necklace: Musketeer Scenario Book 1
Description:
The Mystery of the Queen’s Necklace is the first scenario book for The Kings Musketeers are Wimps: The Queen’s diamond necklace has been stolen and a host of people are looking for it.

There are Musketeers, Cardinal’s Guards, Cardinal’s agents, mercenaries, and thieves searching for it. 
Each player has 3 figures who question townsfolk to find clues to the location of the necklace and who might have.

Two to eight players and an umpire.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.

Name: Judgement of God: Fast Play Medieval Rules
Description:
Judgement of God
 Takes in all the aspects of medieval warfare including the knights, infantry, bow, crossbows and formation.

The rules include the realities of the Swiss and the Mongols.

The Two Page Rules series features rules that are 2 pages long with one combat card that has the information needed to play the game. The sequence of movement is decided by a dice roll and after that, the games follow the sequence of move-fire-move-fire. Casualties are decided simply and effectively. Morale is divided into 4 stages with the chance to rally at each stage. New players should be able to conduct their own transactions by the third move. These are combat rules that reflect the tactics and technologies of their era. Decisions are made by players, not cards or dice. These rules can be used for nearly any scale of the figure. They are great for large or small battles.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Two Page Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Plucky Pikes & Stalwart Shot: Fast Play Pike & Shot Rules
Description:
Plucky Pikes & Stalwart Shot is the rules set for the pike and shot era from roughly the middle of the 16th century to the 2nd half of the 17th century.

The rules take into account cavalry, pike formations, firearms, artillery and bows.

The Two Page Rules series features rules that are 2 pages long with one combat card that has the information needed to play the game. The sequence of movement is decided by a dice roll and after that, the games follow the sequence of move-fire-move-fire. Casualties are decided simply and effectively. Morale is divided into 4 stages with the chance to rally at each stage. New players should be able to conduct their own transactions by the third move. These are combat rules that reflect the tactics and technologies of their era. Decisions are made by players, not cards or dice. These rules can be used for nearly any scale of the figure. They are great for large or small battles.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Two Page Rules (Small War Games)

Name: The Gallant Grenadier: Fast Play 18th Century Rules
Description:
The Gallant Grenadier' is the Small War set of rules for the 18th century. 

It accurately addresses the intricacies of 18th century European warfare including the need to maintain proper formations, platoon fire vs. fire by rank, cavalry and artillery. 
Flank and rear attacks are devastating just as they were at the time.

The Two Page Rules series features rules that are 2 pages long with one combat card that has the information needed to play the game. The sequence of movement is decided by a dice roll and after that, the games follow the sequence of move-fire-move-fire. Casualties are decided simply and effectively. Morale is divided into 4 stages with the chance to rally at each stage. New players should be able to conduct their own transactions by the third move. These are combat rules that reflect the tactics and technologies of their era. Decisions are made by players, not cards or dice. These rules can be used for nearly any scale of the figure. They are great for large or small battles.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Two Page Rules (Small War Games)

Name: The Valiant Voltigeur: Fast Play Napoleonic Rules
Description:
Valiant Voltigeur is the Small War set of rules for the Napoleonic period.

Accurately addresses Column vs. Line, Cavalry vs. Square, 3 rank musketry vs. 2 ranks, artillery and cavalry.  
Flank and rear attacks are devastating just as Napoleon intended.

The Two Page Rules series features rules that are 2 pages long with one combat card that has the information needed to play the game. The sequence of movement is decided by a dice roll and after that, the games follow the sequence of move-fire-move-fire. Casualties are decided simply and effectively. Morale is divided into 4 stages with the chance to rally at each stage. New players should be able to conduct their own transactions by the third move. These are combat rules that reflect the tactics and technologies of their era. Decisions are made by players, not cards or dice. These rules can be used for nearly any scale of the figure. They are great for large or small battles.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Two Page Rules (Small War Games)

Name: Resolute Rebel: Fast Play Civil War Rules
Description:
Resolute Rebel is the Small War set of rules for the American Civil War.

It addresses the increased mobility of civil war formations and the deadly effectiveness of the percussion rifled musket and rifled artillery.

The Two Page Rules series features rules that are 2 pages long with one combat card that has the information needed to play the game. The sequence of movement is decided by a dice roll and after that, the games follow the sequence of move-fire-move-fire. Casualties are decided simply and effectively. Morale is divided into 4 stages with the chance to rally at each stage. New players should be able to conduct their own transactions by the third move. These are combat rules that reflect the tactics and technologies of their era. Decisions are made by players, not cards or dice. These rules can be used for nearly any scale of the figure. They are great for large or small battles.

—description from the publisher
